website_summaries.verdict: Loose-fitting jeans that don’t come across as too baggy. Ideal for those who prefer a slightly roomier fit.
pros: Regular fit waist and 18.5” leg opening
Can be worn cuffed or uncuffed, as baggier fit lends itself to more looks
Most colors and washes feature attractive contrast stitching
cons: Somewhat smaller wash and color assortment compared to other styles

customer_reviews.title: KNOCK-0FFS!
customer_reviews.text: I received a knock-off... so minus another star! I bought the black 569's for my brother who was going on trip. Upon his return, he laundered them. To our chagrin, the jeans came out the wash completely discolored. We've worn Levi's all our lives so we knew that a real Levi's would not fade after one wash, further more upon further inspecting the jeans we found many other signs that these jeans were a knock-off. I've included pictures for your review and comments. The follwing link will help you spot them.
customer_reviews.author: LillyPutian

customer_reviews.title: Ripped after a month
customer_reviews.text: Ordered these jeans back in January 2019, and it took two tries to get an appropriately fitting pair in the size ordered. No biggie, it happens - you sometimes have to try on a few even at the department stores before finding the right ones. Biggest problem with these is they ripped after a month along one of the rear pocket seams, and it appears (at least on quick review of this site before heading to a client's office) that I dont have an option to return them because I'm a week past the 30 day purchase mark. A bit disappointed considering they only got worn 3 times in the last 5 weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: There is an issue with stitching causing failure of belt loops.
customer_reviews.text: I have exchanged a pair and am now returning the second pair for the exact same issue. The belt loop at 4oclock failed. The bottom Stitches gave out and the loop is loose. I checked reviews before buying and there was no mention of this issue.....however, upon requesting a refund this time I looked and saw a few with the same or similar issues. Clearly these jeans had a quality issue, perhaps it was known, perhaps not. Either way, it is an issue and it happened twice to me. I will find a pair elsewhere. Other than the issue, these fit very well. They didn't stretch out easily and held form Well. I enjoyed them until they broke.
customer_reviews.author: Mzzzzzzkay

customer_reviews.title: Absolute crap quality
customer_reviews.text: Quality is something that Levi does not believe in. I don’t know why I keep buying these jeans but this is my last pair. On every pair of jean I buy the belt loops rip within the first 2-3 weeks. Shortly after that the back pockets in the corners will start ripping followed next buy the crotch. I have the same results on every pair on Levi’s that I buy. This has been happening for the last 5 years or so. Never had this problem before then so something has changed in the manufacturing/quality department. I do not recommend these jeans to anyone until they increase the quality of there products.
customer_reviews.author: Casey

customer_reviews.title: Nice pockets, a little baggy but good for big legs
customer_reviews.text: These are a little beggy but that's exactly what I like and why I buy them. I've bought several black pairs at this point and what's weird is sometimes the back label is black, sometimes its the traditional Levi orange. Not a big deal but I'd prefer they were always the more subtle black. I like these mainly because of the slightly stetchy material and the near horizontal entry front pockets which prevent my two phones and wallet from slipping out while sitting down. Not the thickest material but it's not stiff like the commuter Levi's I used to get instead.
customer_reviews.author: Eric the Technotraveller

customer_reviews.title: 569s are no long comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: As some other reviews have posted if 569s have been your go to for the last decade or so you purchase them for their comfort and durability. However, these 569s come with a slightly slimmer leg. Most of all they are also mid rise jeans the belt line is considerably lower then they used to be. This makes them fit tighter around the butt, top of the legs, and causes “plumbers crack”. I have tried several of the Levies different styles and it looks like I am going to have to look else where for jeans that fit my needs. Or my other option is to keep sewing up the holes in my old 569s hahah.
customer_reviews.author: Modern-Memories

customer_reviews.title: These jeans deserve NO Stars
customer_reviews.text: I received these jeans on Dec 4th and wore them for the first time Feb 3rd, the button popped off in hand when I took them off. See attached photo. Unfortunately the return window on these jeans closed on Jan 31, 2017. This is the first time I have had a button on a pair of Levi's fail and I have been wearing Levi's for over 50 years. I have two additional pairs of 569 jeans in the same size that I have been wearing for over a year. It would be great is something could be done. THANKS GG-STL
customer_reviews.author: GG-STL

customer_reviews.title: Absolute crap quality
customer_reviews.text: Was trying to find a replacement for the 560's that are apparently no longer made. I figured these would do, just without a tapered leg. WRONG. The quality of these is sub-standard in every way imaginable. Levi's has gone to heck, no question about it. Thank God I found another person who recommended Dickie's Relaxed Fix jeans as a suitable replacement. They are far and away better quality. And the fit is just what I was looking for. Buh-bye Levi's. After 30+ years of wearing your jeans exclusively, you really blew it.
customer_reviews.author: E. Waggoner

customer_reviews.title: Too tight, style has changed, material thinner
customer_reviews.text: Just purchased these; unfortunately the 569 style no longer is the same. It is now too tight in the thighs and in the seat. They've removed an inch from both areas. They are not 'skinny' jeans, but they are tight on my thighs and ride up my butt as well. Quite disappointed as I purchased the Kale color which has a nice, dark, deep indigo shade. The material was also noticeably thinner than my older pair. Serious company mismanagement Levi's. Why change a style people like and are accustomed to? Just go ahead and make a new style if you want, but don't change the existing styles! I'm returning these ASAP back to Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: H.I.

customer_reviews.title: LOVE these...I'm 5'11, 245, and 42X30 are perfect on me
customer_reviews.text: These came fitting perfect right out of the bag. I'm 5'11, 245, and carry most of my weigh in my stomach. I was worried that a 42 waist wouldn't fit, but after reading reviews on here, I went with it, and boy am I glad. The "Ice Cap" color is great because they definitely look like jeans, but they also almost look like dress slacks. Great dark wash. Also, the material is pretty thin for this color, which is a real plus for me since I live in hot climate, and love traveling to Vegas.
customer_reviews.author: AbsolutelyGenuineReviewerTrustMe

customer_reviews.title: Great Fit - Love These Jeans
customer_reviews.text: For a Female - who can not wear jeans with High Rise These Levis are Perfect Levis are Tried and True for Decades Well Constructed Very Sturdy Well Sewn Seams Low Rise - Sits slightly above hips Roomy / Comfortable through thighs / rear - but not sloppy loose Vintage Light Color is really nice Very soft denim fabric 100 % Cotton Only negative - Little Red Tag on Right Rear Pocket, does NOT SAY " Levis " Just Red Tag - making them look not authentic
customer_reviews.author: mary johnson

customer_reviews.title: Crotch Ripped in less than 2 months
customer_reviews.text: I find it hard to believe that these are genuine Levi's. As other customers have noted, the crotch ripped in these jeans after a short time. I wore these pants less than 10 times before the crotch ripped. They fit well so it was not fit issue. $50 for these jeans is a total rip off... Don't Buy!
customer_reviews.author: soniak

customer_reviews.title: Light weight denim tends to shrink a lot in the length.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a pair of these for my son a few years ago and they became noticeably too short over time. We figured he had just grown so I ordered the next size up and while they fit initially, they too are getting shorter. I measured the inseam of the first pair we bought which were 30x32. These pants are now 30x29. The second pair we ordered were 30x34 and have been washed three times. They are now 30x33. I suspect before long they will be 30x31. My son likes the light weight denim, but I hate the fact that this material shrinks so much in the length. They are only the right length for about 3 months.
customer_reviews.author: E. Scott

customer_reviews.title: Shoddy construction and product! Shameful.
customer_reviews.text: Crap to say the least. First off they arrived with an obvious bleach spot on the front next tot he fly. Secondly, they fit like skinny jeans. Thirdly they craftsmanship is NOT Levi..and if it is, they must have been made in a sweat shop by forced child labor in some third world country. It's annoying that you order something and they arrive and upon inspection you wonder how they even passed quality control, if there is such a thing wherever these were made and by whomever they were made. I'm beginning to lose faith in some of the products I order from Amazon. Even Amazon must maintain some standards. For shame!
customer_reviews.author: Mark J. Merrill

customer_reviews.title: Levi's Jeans: Always great quality...always run small!
customer_reviews.text: Even after losing around 50lbs I am still too big for Levi's 550 Relaxed Fit Jeans. The Relax fit style has a little extra extra room in the thighs, but are fitted around the seat of the pants, thus leaving minimum room in the pockets & fashioning the tug look when I sit down. I am not a big, or the thinnest, but for those who like a little extra room in their clothes I recommend the Levi's 569 Loose Fit Straight Leg. Or, go one size up when you purchase Levi's clothes.
customer_reviews.author: P. Kelsey

customer_reviews.title: FINALLY A TRUE LOOSE FIT PAIR OF JEANS!
customer_reviews.text: FINALLY!! A pair of jeans that aren't stretch or "skinny" type jeans. Not everyone is some middle-school/high-school teen looking for the latest FAD clothing. Some of us just want a good old fashioned pair of jeans that don't strangle your gentiles and stick to your skin like they were actually meant to be painted on. I liked them so much I went back online after wearing them for the first time and ordered another pair!
customer_reviews.author: Ric

customer_reviews.title: You hate those slimfit? this is better than regular fit
customer_reviews.text: Do you have Calves? bit of a junk in the back? but not so much on gut? Hate them skinny fit? (So stupid to have 4 size bigger waiste to get pants stuck at calves?) If you answered Yes to one of those. This pants is for you. Yes you would still lose your calf hair by friction, Yes ass is bit tight. But at least you dont have to buy 2-4size larger waist in order to pull up beyond knee, thigh, ass, and purchase a belt.
customer_reviews.author: Kaz

customer_reviews.title: GARBAGE!! "Much thinner" than Levis 569 I buy in store
customer_reviews.text: Pants fit as expected. However, I typically purchase Levis 569 at retail stores around me. I ordered the black as they are only offered online. These "jeans" are significantly thinner than the rest of mine, making me feel like I just purchased bootlegged Levis. Hate how thin they feel, no protection you'd expect from any jeans and I cannot imagine these will last very long from basic wear & tear. Never ordering jeans online again. Did this years ago, & recieved the same thin garbage. Didnt think it would happen again....shame on me. The quality of material is thin garbage......dont waste your $ on this if your looking for quality jeans with apparent durability....
customer_reviews.author: KOOCH

customer_reviews.title: Love the look and feel.
customer_reviews.text: I am 6' tall and like pants that sit just above my hips. These do just that and are comfortable ti sit, stand, squat and walk in. The color is perfect for worn look without being torn. I have them in a 30" and 32" length. The 32 is a bit long but when sitting leg over other knee they stay over the shoe. The 30 length is perfect when standing but just above the ankle when sitting. These do sit at the hip so keep that in mind. I wish they made a 31" length. Great jeans and quality.
customer_reviews.author: Must Love Subies

customer_reviews.title: Not your old Levis 569 jeans
customer_reviews.text: These jeans are not the old Levis 569 jeans. They are not durable and don't hold up to normal wear and tear. Out of the ones I bought from Amazon and elsewhere all of them have had either a belt loop rip off or tears develop in the seams in less than a year of occasional use. Half of them didn't last 6 months of occasional use. The material is thin and flimsy. The stitching is of below average quality for jeans. Yes the Levis 569 jeans I purchased pre 2007 are still holding up. I would not recommend buying these jeans. You get a cheap, poorly constructed product made from sub par materials.
customer_reviews.author: Chris B.

customer_reviews.title: But Levis quality control across different colors etc is very poor. You can buys same exact size in another ...
customer_reviews.text: These fit right.. because I brought them before and know that they fit ( also because they are black stretch unlike some of the others which are not stretch). But Levis quality control across different colors etc is very poor. You can buys same exact size in another color and may not fit the same.. some of that is because different colors are sometimes made in different countries etc. Had to learn the hard way.
customer_reviews.author: Paul P.

customer_reviews.title: Short in the Inseam and not loose fit.
customer_reviews.text: I said the jeans are somewhat small, but that’s not entirely accurate. They’re big in the waist, big in the legs around the ankle (almost boot cut bordering on bell bottoms), but they are anything but loose in the thigh and seat and very short in the crotch. They’re just uncomfortable and they appear to be knock offs or irregular or something. The Levi’s tag on the pocket is missing the word Levi’s. It’s blank. I recall those being imitation levi’s when I was a kid. Hope these last, but based on other reviews I’m not thinking they will.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Clark

customer_reviews.title: Favorite Jeans
customer_reviews.text: Growing up I wore Levis Silvertab Jeans. These are the closest jeans I have found to that 1990's fit. The colors are great. The feel is great. They wear well and seem to last for a long time. I have had a few pairs for about 5 years now and they look new. They are a little big and fit loose on your waist and legs. If you want a tighter fit buy a smaller size or a different fit. These are "LOOSE" jeans.
customer_reviews.author: Helper123654

customer_reviews.title: Not the quality pants I remember
customer_reviews.text: This is my first Pair of Levi’s in many years. I was expecting rivets in all the stress point especially on rear pockets where I have found other type jeans tear our. I found that these pants not as heavy duty as I remember the older ones that I grew up with. They just don’t give me the feeling of quality that used to have. Even the leather patch seems cheap. For the price I think I will just go back to the wranger pants that are 1/2 the price.
customer_reviews.author: A F Thorsen

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful From Levis
customer_reviews.text: Pros - The design looks good and I love the color and I love it because this is not skin tide and the jeans are a loose fit as describe. Cons - The problem that I have is that this jeans run big I bought a size 30/30 and it looks more like a 31/31 size jeans the waist is really bigger than a true size 30 waist and they are also very long almost hitting the floor when I have them on. You have to take them a size smaller than your usual size or is going to be a bit bigger for you.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel C.

customer_reviews.title: One of my All Time Favorites from Levi
customer_reviews.text: These are the perfect jeans for a "Dad Bod", casual, no need to have it tight anymore.... The waist stretches a bit, the jeans are loose but not baggy, very comfortable. Fit= my waist is a 36 but the size 34 fits perfect---I have really long legs and the 34 length is great- way below my ankle but not dragging on the ground. These are all I wear, in my Levi's for a number of years now. I love them!
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Straight to the point review.
customer_reviews.text: Says loose, however the pants are too tight for a MAN. It seems as companies are trying to force MEN to get use to the idea of wearing skinny jeans... Never going to happen.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Who thinks old men like me want a drop waist on their jeans?
customer_reviews.text: I wanted the 560 style, which has fit me nicely over the years, but it seems they have dropped that, and the only style with generous fit in the crotch area is the 569, which is the drop-waist version of the same pair of pants. Did anyone ask us old guys whether we wanted a low-waist pair of jeans? Do other people like the constant feeling that their pants are falling down? Levi, bring back the 560 and stop trying to turn us into hipsters. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Barry

customer_reviews.title: Fumes—probably VOCs (and health hazard)—even after multiple washes
customer_reviews.text: Not only does the burnt tire smell not wash out after multiple washes, other clothes in the wash end up strongly tainted with the same fumes. Smells like a combination of burnt truck tires and formaldehyde. If formaldehyde and/or other VOCs are involved that presents a serious cancer risk to the wearer and anyone nearby exposed to the fumes.
customer_reviews.author: Gentleman of the Road

customer_reviews.title: Not Loose
customer_reviews.text: These jeans say loose fit but they are far from it. I'm not a heavy guy, about 5'11' and 165lbs. These jeans fit like all the other skinny fit garbage out there just with a wider calf, I even ordered a size above regular. Do not recommend these if you're looking for an actual pair of men's jeans. These are going to fit you like your sister's pants would.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: whats wrong with this material
customer_reviews.text: I ordered 4 pairs of these jeans for my son. He has worn them "normally" as you would any Levi jean. They have all developed frays and holes in the very same spot around the lower end of the zipper to the right side. I sew a lot but don't feel like I should have to fix a manufacturing defect which is what I feel this is! The material in these jeans seems to be very thin, unlike the other jeans he has that he purchased in a clothing store! Are these seconds? I am afraid to order any more from this site!!! Would like replacement or reimbursement for all 4 pairs. You can have these back!!!!
customer_reviews.author: SUSAN M. WOLFE

customer_reviews.title: I really liked the looks of these jeans
customer_reviews.text: I really liked the looks of these jeans. (that's why I bought them in the first place:) The color was fairly true to what you see on screen, but the size was not. I ordered a size 33w x 34l. You can see in the attached picture that the size was actually a 37w. I tried to wear them, but they were just too big.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon customer

customer_reviews.title: Pockets too tight.
customer_reviews.text: I will probably keep these pants, but the rating is definitely going to be only 3 stars. The pocket area is way too tight. Men do not carry purses. We keep our smartphones, wallets, keys, headphones, and sometimes power cords in our pockets. The fit really ought to be looser and baggier in the thigh area. I don't like it.
customer_reviews.author: G.S. Muse

customer_reviews.title: Beware of being sent the wrong size because of them being mislabled
customer_reviews.text: These Levi's jeans are good jeans. These 569 loose fitting kind are the only ones my husband likes to wear. The problem I have with them is that I ordered 36-32, and recieved 34-32. It was not that someone messed up and sent the wrong size either. All the tags and stickers on the jeans said they were 36-32, but they were mislabeled. The jeans said the correct size on the tag inside and the label on the back. So beware if you order these, you may be sent the wrong size.
customer_reviews.author: Savannah W.

customer_reviews.title: Long live Levi's!
customer_reviews.text: Really love the brand. This are truly hardcore jeans. I'm a 240 pounds hyperactive man and i move a lot I usually rip my jeans in the first 6 months of use but Levi's jeans usually have a long life with me. TIP: If you're not sure what number to buy (this one is a 569 jeans) go to a local store and try a few numbers. i'm a big guy and 569 and 505 jeans are a perfect fit for me.
customer_reviews.author: Javier Rz

customer_reviews.title: Levi's quality has dropped significantly
customer_reviews.text: Have been wearing Levi's for over 25 years and these 569's are no way near the quality of what Silver Tab's were. Material is much thinner and stitching is not the old Levi's rugged quality. The 569's tend to tear much easier and start coming apart where stitching occurs around belt loops. Tend to purchase when they are $40 because anything over that is out of the question.
customer_reviews.author: Ernesto Aleman

customer_reviews.title: Good jeans
customer_reviews.text: Have gotten this same style of jeans for years. Not every pair fits exactly the same, but it’s always close enough for me. Only problem has been some seem to shrink a bit more than others in the wash/dryer and the legs sometimes get a little shorter than I’d like, so I’d recommend erring on the too big side. But it’s a quality pair of jeans and no complaints, which I suppose is why I keep buying them.
customer_reviews.author: t

customer_reviews.title: Been wearin' em for a long time . . .
customer_reviews.text: I ran across Levi's 569s about ten years ago and have been wearing them since then. But . . . when I could no longer find them locally (I live in a rural area), I turned to amazon and there they were. I like their light denim and their looser fit, and these fit well and were offered by Amazon at a reasonable price. This is a win-win situation for me!
customer_reviews.author: JayArr

customer_reviews.title: If it fits I sit
customer_reviews.text: These are my go to jeans. They're not too tight around the legs so I don't feel like I'm going to rip my pants when I'm outside doing activities. I've tried others but I keep going back to this style. I must say my wife has always not liked these jeans, probably because I wasn't wearing the right size. Well, I've put on some weight and she now says they look great. *dying inside*
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Something is fishy
customer_reviews.text: These are the thinnest jeans I have ever seen I have slacks thicker. Not anything like the 569's I buy at local department store. I honestly question if these are counterfeit. I pulled out an old pair of 569's and there almost 2 times heavier. The jean tag is paper. If this is indeed real brand name they won't be selling junk like this much longer. It's time for me to find another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: PEEFECT
customer_reviews.text: My hubby has a xrazy hard time finding jeans that fit him comfortably. At 6 feet and 275 pounds of strong man training, most jeans are just not cut for him. He LOVES these! We will be ordering more!
customer_reviews.author: Cara miniatt

customer_reviews.title: Wish I would have bought more!
customer_reviews.text: These jeans are awesome!!! I love how they stretch a little bit which allows for additional flexibility and comfort. I purchased a pair during a holiday discount and when I wore them the first time I immediately ordered 2 more pair. I still wish I would have purchased 2 more after that. Oh well, there's always next year (maybe???).
customer_reviews.author: 1stn10

customer_reviews.title: Good fit, decent quality materials and construction, good color retention
customer_reviews.text: These have been my go-to cut of jeans for a while now. They fit my particular proportions better than any other cut I've tried. They hold up well to activity and long wear periods and they have good color retention. I wish Amazon had a better way to sort them by wash, weight, and build, but that's apparently too difficult. Oh well, maybe some day. Regardless, I love Levi's 569s and I'll keep on wearing them for almost anything I have to do.
customer_reviews.author: Robert O. Sims

customer_reviews.title: Happy with purchase of Levi’s- ordered several.
customer_reviews.text: These are very good! Why negative reviews?! Listen ... quality denim here. Good fitting as long as you know your size waist and length. My husband wears them for work daily. They wash and dry just fine. He says that the jeans are comfortable! Definitely for a manly man and the things they do! Ha ha! FYI - he looks so great in them!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Hadley

customer_reviews.title: 0 out of 10
customer_reviews.text: After the very first washing there is a hole right below the fly in the crouch area. It’s right where you can’t miss it. I will mevwr buy this type of Levi’s again. I have work Levi’s all my life and never had I had this happen jeans usually last years. Not this pair. Save your money don’t buy
customer_reviews.author: Kris

customer_reviews.title: Horrible
customer_reviews.text: I used to love Levi's. I've been wearing 569's for over 20 years. I have several pair still that I bought over the years, and when one finally wore out, I got these. The dramatic loss in quality is astounding. The material is so thin, it's feels like it'll tear at any point, and it's much noisier than previous purchases. Levi's needs to get their act together and go back to being a quality brand instead of a fashion brand.
customer_reviews.author: dredg

customer_reviews.title: Manufacturer sizing inconsistencies.
customer_reviews.text: In some cuts of jeans I'd wear 32" waist, but in others 33" and others still 31" waist. Manufacturers need to indicate the actual number of inches rather than a random designation. I'm hoping these shrink a little with a couple washings. Also, know that there exist people whose leg measurements are longer than the waist measurements, and that we're not rare mutations in an otherwise too wide society. This is especially important, when people are looking for straight-leg cuts because we actually have developed calves because of our physical activity routine.
customer_reviews.author: John Steiner

customer_reviews.title: Super comfortable
customer_reviews.text: So my belt measurement below the waist where I wear my pants measures about 41" in case you're trying to figure out if these pants will fit. Every brand is different. These pants pit nicely. Got a pair of these on Prime Day and am glad I did. The non-Denizen version of Levis are very sturdy from what I can gather. These look very nice, are comfortable and will likely buy more.
customer_reviews.author: Mitch

customer_reviews.title: Husband prefers these
customer_reviews.text: My husband has been wearing this style for several years. We bought him some jeans from American Eagle because they had a sale and he doesn't like them as much. The denim is thinner and feels weird, plus one of the pairs began fraying and developing holes after only a few months of wear (in rotation with two other pairs). He looks good in these. We probably won't ever buy another brand or style.
customer_reviews.author: Kymberly

customer_reviews.title: I like the design
customer_reviews.text: I like the design, color, and material. The jeans however have a tighter fit and seem to be shorter than what the measurements read. After washing my jeans they seem to have gotten worse. I recommend going up 1-2 sizes on the waist and 2-3 sizes on the length. I should have tried them on sooner before my return window closed, now I'm just disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: meh...
customer_reviews.text: It's hard to explain, but these pants are actually heavy, they pull down because of their weight. I was really hoping for something lighter or at least a normal denim feel, but it seems like the stretch jeans that are offered seem to weigh a bit more and because of that they are constantly sliding out of position and feel like they're coming off it sounds ridiculous but that's the way they wear.
customer_reviews.author: C. B.

customer_reviews.title: TERRIBLE JEANS
customer_reviews.text: These are the worst pair of blue jeans I have bought from Levi.For jeans that are suppose to be loose they fit me like slim pants. I am not over weight. You could see the stiches straining on the thigh. And to add insult to injury-the a belt loop broke the first day I wore them. The material is thin and strecky. Levi's quality has gone down hill for many years and these pants just show how bad they have become. I have worn Levis for over thirty years and now I have to try and find some jeans that are thick and made to last-not these. Am returning them
customer_reviews.author: Grandma3

customer_reviews.title: ordered for husband
customer_reviews.text: Ordered 34W 34L, which he said he needed, but has not worn in a while. They were to big, will be returning for a smaller waist size. Also, these have stretch in fabric, so they will stretch when worn. As I have found out with my jeans that have stretch in fabric.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected
customer_reviews.text: No problem with seller or shipping but the jeans them selves were a disappointment. I had read a review saying if you liked 560's which have been discontinued you'll love these. Not the case at all, these have a much lower waistline causing drooping and plumbers butt. ..... other than that the fit is good though
customer_reviews.author: cindy quillen

customer_reviews.title: Last pair for me
customer_reviews.text: Heres a picture of two of the same model and size, one fits like it should the other is huge. I've worn Levis my whole life and i am through. I wont support this lousy downhill QC. Imported garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Roland

customer_reviews.title: Nice casual look
customer_reviews.text: I'm 54 years old and the slim fit look just doesn't work for me. The loose fit is more comfortable and can be dressed up or down depending on the look you want. The wider leg also falls very nicely on casual dress shoes.
customer_reviews.author: timothy cooper

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable Levi’ 569 Stretch Jeans
customer_reviews.text: Stretch jeans are the only ones that I buy. Ordered Levi’s 569 34x32 on sale for $35.95 and like the fit. The 34 waist provides room in the thighs and enough stretch for easy movement. My previous Levi’s 569 stretch jeans have survived for 10 years and I still wear them.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Just what I expected
customer_reviews.text: I have been wearing different styles of Levi's for years. This pair of jeans is everything I have come to expect from Levi's. The pants fit exactly as I am familiar with. I had bought a few styles of a different brand after a major weight loss and never felt comfortable in them. The smaller Levi's fit just as comfortably as the larger sizes I used to wear. I will be continuing to purchase more pairs of Levi's in the smaller size.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Helmbrecht

customer_reviews.title: My pair was quite small in the inseam and waist
customer_reviews.text: compared to other 569's I own, length is quite short and waist is a little small, and being 100% cotton they did shrink after the first wash.. Levis states tolerances of the nominal size plus/minus 1.5" which to me seems quite excessive as that would mean a 30" inseam could be 28.5 or 31.5 (before shrinking in the wash). Same for waist measurements.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron W.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Big Legs
customer_reviews.text: These are the first jeans that I can honestly say fit me perfectly year round. My weight fluctuates throughout the year. Thanks to the stretchyness, they always fit. In addition, my legs are larger than most in comparison to my small waist. It makes it REALLY hard to find pants that fit without javing to tailor them. These fit everytime. I've literally replaced all my jeans with these!
customer_reviews.author: JD Fernandez

customer_reviews.title: All is well with the jeans I purchased. I ...
customer_reviews.text: All is well with the jeans I purchased. I purchased this pair for winter use and it was a success. Thank you for getting them made and my judgement to use them with all the clothes I wanted to wear for ice and snow work. I have nothing more to offer. Thank you for asking for my input. CLW
customer_reviews.author: CLW

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect. Fit and look great. These are jeans I use at the office because they're so black. Just remember to follow the wash instructions otherwise the black will fade out and reveal that jean status. Love em.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Not loose at all
customer_reviews.text: Ok, so they're Levis; they're a high quality product that looks good, but that's where it ends. The legs are definitely straight, but there's nothing loose about this fit! I had to squeeze into them this morning and the front pockets are tight! I'll amend this review as I try the other pair, but if these shrink after I wash them, there's no way I'll be able to wear them! And I was just wearing a pair of Levi's Loose Straight Leg jeans, yesterday that fit
customer_reviews.author: Regis Bodnar

customer_reviews.title: The buttons did not look like the examples I saw on line
customer_reviews.text: I can’t be 100% sure but I believe my Levi’s were counterfeit. They material was much much thinner than any Levi I have ever owned. I checked the various clues to verify counterfeit. Several “clues” passed the test however the leather tag didn’t quite look right, but it was borderline. The leather tag should appear well worn and have specific writings. All of the print on the leather tag was correct but it wasn’t well worn, so I give it an indecisive indicator. The buttons did not look like the examples I saw on line. Between the material thickness and the buttons and the questionable leather tag, I decided to return them. No problems with the return, very easy.
customer_reviews.author: Martin E. Boyce

customer_reviews.title: Inconsistency across styles
customer_reviews.text: I had a pair of 569 jeans I bought late last year. I really like them, so I just ordered another pair but changed the style slightly. First pair was darker and new pair is the Vintage. I am disappointed that the same "569" jeans are not the same. The new Vintage style is more flimsy and lightweight. I didn't expect the build quality to change so drastically just because I changed the color of the 569 jeans I was purchasing. The waist fits just right on the first pair and I notice a little more looseness on the second pair of 569. So, my conclusion is that it's a crapshoot.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Lancaster

customer_reviews.title: Buy from a box store! Poor quality!
customer_reviews.text: Fits like Levi’s, 2 months in on 2 amazon pants and 3 from kohl's. Amazon pants now have patches on both thighs and back pockets. These are either knock offs or rejects from Levi’s. Was in a hurry and store didn't have enough pairs so tried Amazon again. These are worse than the last pair I bought from Amazon. Hoped they had gotten better! They haven't.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for price
customer_reviews.text: Not bad for price. Bought two other pairs that fit but this particular pair fit too big. Returned the pants and they were received 4/28/2020 and I am still waiting for my money. Looks like I will to call my credit card company and put in a dispute.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Strange stretchy jean, but fits great! I will buy more pairs!
customer_reviews.text: I have to say, these jeans are quite strange in their fit, but i like them. i come from wearing American Eagle Loose jeans, but since they never seem to have my size in stock, i felt that i needed to jump to a new brand/style. I know Levi's is a good brand, and once i decoded their numbering system, i found these. i was a little put off by the stretch, but i like it so far! it definitely adds mobility and doesn't restrict movements like conventional jeans. as these jeans wear and break in, i bet these will fit perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Jacob G.

customer_reviews.title: Cheap Jeans Ripped in a Month
customer_reviews.text: These jeans are junk. I've had them for 2 months and maybe worn them a total of 4 weeks and already have a rip at the back top corner pocket and just under the zipper in the crotch area. I had a pair identical to these bought in the store and had them 3 years and never ripped. Now I'm past the return date and I'm out $40. Absolute garbage jeans.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Miles

customer_reviews.title: Do not really fit like loose fit
customer_reviews.text: These are supposed to be loose fit but I have a size below the size I bought of the same model that fit me better. Not sure if they changed the material supplier in the past 5 yrs, but these definitely are not loose fit.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin C

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: I love Levi’s. And with these loose straight you actually has some leg room, for those of us who actually do leg day.
customer_reviews.author: Julius Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Nice Fit for the 569 Levi's Jeans
customer_reviews.text: It is hard for me to choose this product over the Levi's Men's 541 Athletic Fit Jean but it is equally as comfortable, durable and affordable. Some sellers seem to offer one of these selections for a few dollars less. I'd select either the 569 or the 541 interchangeably based upon price and save a few dollars.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Inconsistent sizing between colors
customer_reviews.text: The Vintage Light color was significantly tighter than the Crosstown- Stretch. The Vintage light fit more like a slim fit than a loose fit. I ordered a waist size up and they were wearable, but still about an inch tighter in the upper thigh, seat area. This could be due to them being made in different countries. Vintage Light is made in Cambodia, while Crosstown-Stretch was made in Pakistan.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Koerner

customer_reviews.title: Great Jeans!
customer_reviews.text: I wear only 569 Levi jeans. I love that they are looser through the legs and not so tight as most jeans are now days, and don't show every flaw you may have with your legs! I swear some people don't look at themselves in the mirror before they go out in public!
customer_reviews.author: Linda L johnson

customer_reviews.title: Loose Easy Fit
customer_reviews.text: I have been wearing the 569 style for years. Its the only brand that fits my legs through the thigh. I recently bought these as they were black and the only way I could get a black pair was to order them. These had the stretchy material built in and all I can say is I have been missing this my whole life. Im ordering more.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: You Can't Go Wrong with Levi's
customer_reviews.text: Everyone in my family wears Levi's. I was a bit apprehensive ordering them from Amazon but they are just as awesome as if I bought them from a store. My son is hard on his pants but these are still around. They look good and they last AND they're inexpensive.
customer_reviews.author: Deanna Griffith

customer_reviews.title: My hips don't lie
customer_reviews.text: I love these jeans in this particular denim blend. They can take a LOT of abuse and keep coming back for more. Plus they work really well when you wear them more than one day in a row before tossing them in the laundry. My only complaint is that the rise is too low for my big butt. I have a tush from all my years of ice hockey, then roller hockey, then triathlon, and now just cycling. Any ways, when I bend over, even with a belt, CRACK KILLS!! Otherwise, love them. I'm going to keep wearing them, my butt crack hanging out will have to be other people's issue. . .sorry in advance.
customer_reviews.author: cplummer17

customer_reviews.title: For those who comment that the newer ones don't fit like your last pair
customer_reviews.text: The gold standard. You may buy other brands for style, color, design, brand recognition, whatever. At the end of the day Levi's are still around and people keep coming back to them because Levi's knows what they are doing. For those who comment that the newer ones don't fit like your last pair, check your shape. Chances are the last pair is well worn in and stretched. The newer ones need time to break in or you can buy a size up or go with a more washed/treated pair which won't last as long but are already broken in. That's what I needed to do. Love them.
customer_reviews.author: Trophy Husband

customer_reviews.title: Nice loose fit jean
customer_reviews.text: Fit perfect , sick of all this skinny jean crap .
customer_reviews.author: Woody

customer_reviews.title: Very low quality product.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve worn 569s since they came out. I removed the tags from this pair of pants this morning and wore them for the first time, after wearing for a few hours they tore right below the zipper while picking something from the floor. Don’t know if it was cheap Chinese denim or was sown badly, this has never happened to me and will not happen again. I will never buy this type of stuff from amazon, it’s getting more common with stuff I buy here breaking faster than store bought products.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas E Wilkins Jr

customer_reviews.title: Lee-hehe-vi!!!
customer_reviews.text: I truly enjoy these jeans. Sure I could spend more on some designer jeans and I have but these are my favorite Levi’s and one favorite brands. I’ve have several pair, some are older and they are nicely. Comfort and quality with these 509s for sure!
customer_reviews.author: CompewterBlue

customer_reviews.title: Great pair of Levis blue jeans.
customer_reviews.text: Great pair of pants. Hard to find one you like but glad I did. Never knew there were so many colors and styles for a pair of blue jeans but these are my favorite and I am on the more muscular side and can't stand the skinny jeans style nor can I fit in them. This pair is my style
customer_reviews.author: robbob

customer_reviews.title: " more like "relaxed. " I am quite disappointed that Levi ...
customer_reviews.text: I have been buying a 569 36W34L for the last few years. The pairs that I bought from the stores fit me perfectly. However this pair is very different from the previous ones, despite being the same model and same size. It's made from a thicker fabric (so it's bound to be excessively hot in the summer), and is anything but "loose," more like "relaxed." I am quite disappointed that Levi is unable to control the quality better than that. After all, it's a matter of dimensions and lengths of fabric -- not exactly a rocket science!
customer_reviews.author: Jovi

customer_reviews.title: Finally a pair of jeans that fit a tall guy with thick quads
customer_reviews.text: I am six foot four and two hundred sixty pounds of German Swiss food devouring machine and these jeans fit me! My feet are size 14 and so my quads are pretty big and what the hell is up with guys wearing skinny jeans? That is for the girls! Its hard to find jeans that fit and when I do, its almost always some random pair I find at the bottom of some drawer. So when I found this on amazon I saved every color they had to all of my lists, and I am loving how comfortable they fit and they don't hike up on me at all while on my feet or sitting during school
customer_reviews.author: SeattleAndrew

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: Do Not buy! Every single one of these jeans have ripped at both pockets and in crotch area. My husband does not carry a wallet in back pocket, so no extra weight. These pan4s are very loose on him. 2 of these pair ripped within 2 days of wearing! POOR QUALITY FOR LEVI !! WILL NOT BUY AGAIN!
customer_reviews.author: Denise Oslund

customer_reviews.title: Levi’s are always the best and reasonably priced.
customer_reviews.text: Buying These jeans was a no brained for Me. Due to my Lower body type smaller waist and large thighs I can’t wear most cuts of levies. 569’s have fit right the last 30 years so no reason the change. They do fit a bit loose but not baggy. And I’m not going to spend $300 on some designer jeans that simply won’t last as long as Levi’s do or fit super tight. ONLY PROBLEM- the only problem is the color (although code on jeans was correct to the color) didn’t match what was in the picture well. They are darker but I still like them and needed New jeans so I kept them.
customer_reviews.author: D Rago

customer_reviews.title: Levis 569 vintage light
customer_reviews.text: levis 569, vintage light. I like the style, the color. The fit was good, but others reviewers are right, these are thin material. Not like the old levies I used to get. I imagine they will wear out pretty quick. But I like the fit well enough it overrides the cost reduction.. Hate skinny jeans.
customer_reviews.author: J-rod

customer_reviews.title: Becareful with the size, they tend to shrink to the next size down somehow but only in length, not waist.
customer_reviews.text: These are identical to the other Levis 569 jeans I bought with this order besides color. After 1 wash, they have become floods! I'm not sure what happened but it certainly wasn't hot water and high heat. One pair was made in Mexico (fit), the other in Cambodia (not fit). Clearly there is a difference between the two in length.
customer_reviews.author: NCSUfan2013

customer_reviews.title: Not as expected
customer_reviews.text: Levi's 569 used to be the same as 560s, except one was straight leg. These fit nothing like the last 569s I had, or anything like the 560s I am wearing. Much tighter in the waist and thigh. If you can get the right size, they are great.
customer_reviews.author: Mc4

customer_reviews.title: Levi great but not all are cut the same
customer_reviews.text: I have 569 jeans and they fit great so decided to get some on Amazon for a better price BUT these jeans felt like they were bell bottoms. So all Levi jeans are not cut the same which is a shame as that shows poor quality production of the jeans and loss of customer.
customer_reviews.author: JustMe

customer_reviews.title: Impressively Poor Quality
customer_reviews.text: Nice looking but extremely poor quality. I don't see any of the obvious signs of counterfeits but I am seriously wondering if they are due to the impressively awful build quality. Ive ordered these multiple times and they usually last a few months. The recent pair I ordered lasted a total of 3 wears before the fabric broke down and developed a hole. I will not be ordering more.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Thanks to amazon i have my new favorite pair of jeans
customer_reviews.text: Another great find at my amazon! I would have never thought they sold my favorite brand of jeans! Now im going to get in trouble! Amazon you make it to easy shop. You have EVERYTHING THAT HAS CAME TO MIND! Thank you mr scared. Lol
customer_reviews.author: I belong @ the beach

customer_reviews.title: good price
customer_reviews.text: Old school here - lighter levi than in the past but price reflects this - Cheapness shorting belt loops - Probably trying to save money need to add the loops they removed - belt rides up over jeans - very uncomfortable - cheap
customer_reviews.author: J. Gedney

customer_reviews.title: Denim Quality and Fit
customer_reviews.text: I'm old school. Denim material too thin for my taste. Felt like I was wearing linen pants. Fit was not good as well. Even though my size, very loose in the waist and very tight in the crotch area. Jeans are sort of made were they sag down to your butt. This style is not for me. Returned.
customer_reviews.author: artcal

customer_reviews.title: Defective stitching.
customer_reviews.text: Unhappy. Leg seams are very crooked and poorly sewn. The seam twists so it lands at my shin and is uncomfortable. Pretty irritated because I already washed them. I would think Levi was such a company to sell defective items on line to screw over a customer. Will not buy these on line ever again.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony LaCorte

customer_reviews.title: Good for 4-6 months then a hole will appear in rear
customer_reviews.text: I wear these once weekly for work in an office job. The last 3 pair I have ordered have all lasted about 5 months according to my order history. They all develop a weak spot and then rip under the thigh somewhere as they are very thin material down there. I do not recommend if you are around 220lbs and 6'.
customer_reviews.author: Westmont Guy

customer_reviews.title: Better than the 559 model
customer_reviews.text: Material seems more durable and the fit is generally better (for me). On the other hand, the Levis size label on the back fell off the first day I wore the jeans -- it was glued (very poorly) rather than stitched on. Overall, a good pair of jeans -- not as good as Levis of a few years ago but markedly better than the 559s I've bought in the last year.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis E Murphy

customer_reviews.title: The number stayed the same but the cut changed
customer_reviews.text: The current Levi's Men's 569 Loose Straight-Leg Jeans are not cut like my old 569 jeans! The legs and thighs are much skinnier and the pockets are smaller. Levi Jeans - please bring back the original cut 569 jeans and in the future if you want to restyle a product, change the number to reflect that it's been modified!
customer_reviews.author: RP Smith

customer_reviews.title: Levi’s jeans are no more
customer_reviews.text: Today Levi’s are not Levi’s at least not like the ones I use to buy. I’m 54 and have been wearing Levi’s ever since I was a kid. Back then (70s and 80s), the material was heavy and not just some denim blue dyed thin material they sell these days. I can’t find a decent fitting pair of Levi’s anywhere. I brought 3 pairs of Levi’s , all the same size and they each fit different I spoke to Levi’s customer service and the most I got was were sorry.
customer_reviews.author: AE

customer_reviews.title: Nice jeans just fit funny
customer_reviews.text: Jeans were too big in some places and too tight in others sizes are definitely strange
customer_reviews.author: Danielle silvia

product_meta.title: Levi's Men's 569 Loose Straight Fit Jean
product_meta.description: A modern, laid-back fit. Roomy feel, but not baggy.
feature_bullets: Extra room through seat and thigh
